venue.address_2: west side of the Saco River at a paved parking lot near the Notchland Inn
venue.name: Notchland Davis Path Trailhead

item.description:
Enjoy a magnificent view of Crawford Notch, the Dry River valley, and the surrounding ridges and peaks.


We will be hiking to Mt Crawford and Mt Stairs via the famous Davis Path and returning the same trail.

The Davis Path was constructed as a bridle path to ascend Mount Washington in 1845 by Nathaniel Davis, son-in-law of Abel and Hannah Crawford, of Crawford Notch fame. However, the path could not be properly maintained, and it fell out of use within approximately 10 years. In 1910, the path was reconstructed for foot travel.

At 3,119 feet, Mount Crawford shares the Bemis Ridge with lesser known peaks Mount Hope and Hart Ledge. Mt .Crawford is the first peak ascended by the historic Davis Path. The trail leading to the summit was constructed as a bridle path, so grades are "easy to moderate" all the way to Mount Washington, approximately 15 miles from the trailhead.

Our hike will take in consideration the early winter conditions and how the group feels after reaching Mt Crawford as to whether we continue on to Mt Stairs.



We must adhere to backcountry rules for the Presidential-Dry River Wilderness, which is located within the White Mountain National Forest.

Basically, the same rules as the White Mountain National Forest, plus the following rules specific to the Wilderness:

# No motorized equipment or mechanical transport

# Hiking and camping group size must be limited to 10 people or less

# No camping, wood or charcoal fires within 200 feet of any trail except at designated campsites




Total distance to Mt Stairs and returning to the trailhead:
Distance 9.80 mi
Time 8 hr 0 min
Elev Gain +3534 ft
Elev Loss -3534 ft
Elev Change 0 ft

All hikers should review the White Mountain trail map and review the hike plan. Your link to the hike itinerary is here for printing:Mt Crawford and Mt Stairs hike plan

Winter conditions are in effect. We will be hiking a wonderful but exposed trail. Pack and dress for full winter conditions. Microspikes/crampons are mandatory on all winter hikes. Watch for weather updates for BARTLETT, NH. Snowshoes may be needed if we get a good snowfall.

A severe winter advisory will cancel the event.


We would like to see at least 4 "yes" RSVP's to create a meetup. Your assistance on the trail is always welcome and helps in making a Meetup

Please keep your rsvp's up to date. Its very important that we have a true headcount, and not worry that your late or lost trying to find the trailhead.

Every hiker is important on a hike, especially if we divide the hike into a fast and slow group, or if there is an injury.

Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the NEHAAG disclaimer.

Make sure your hiker profile is complete so we can verify that your qualified to join us on this White Mountain hike. This is a rated a moderate to advanced hike depending on your physical condition due to the +3534 ft elevation gain.

Carpooling is always advised and a great way to get to know your fellow members.
item.name: Mt Crawford and Mt Stairs
